intro: Phyllostegia lantanoides, commonly known as the silverleaf stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of silvery hair, giving it its common name. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
